definitions.definition: used to show that you are almost certain of what you are saying and want other people to agree with you

examples.text: Surely we should do something about it?
It's surely only a matter of time before he is found, isn't it?
Surely by now, things could be organized better?
Oil prices will surely have some impact on trade.

definitions.definition: used with a negative to show that something surprises you and you do not want to believe it

examples.text: Surely you don't think I was responsible for this?
He knew that if help did not arrive soon they would surely die.

definitions.definition: used to say ‘yes’ to somebody or to agree to something

examples.text: We'll get there slowly but surely.
